leveraged buyout.translation[0].definiti: when someone borrows money to buy all or most of the stock of a company by promising to pay the bank back by selling the company’s assets if they cannot pay back the money they borrowed
leveraged buyout.translation[1].definiti: when a person or organization buys a company using a loan borrowed against the company’s assets, some of which may then be sold to pay off the loan
With debt taken on in a $4.9 billion leveraged buyout, the company could not afford to pay all its bills.
